source.4c520bac:
#Code from Gabriel Preda
#plt.style.use('dark_background')
def plot_count(feature, title, df, size=1):
    f, ax = plt.subplots(1,1, figsize=(4*size,4))
    total = float(len(df))
    g = sns.countplot(df[feature], order = df[feature].value_counts().index[:20], palette= ('#32a852', '#a84e32', '#3242a8'))
    g.set_title("Number and percentage of {}".format(title))
    if(size > 2):
        plt.xticks(rotation=90, size=8)
    for p in ax.patches:
        height = p.get_height()
        ax.text(p.get_x()+p.get_width()/2.,
                height + 3,
                '{:1.2f}%'.format(100*height/total),
                ha="center") 
    plt.show()

source.2757a0de:
#Gender Inequality 

Gender Inequality is the social process by which men and women are not treated as equals. The treatment may arise from distinctions regarding biology, psychology, or cultural norms. Some of these distinctions are empirically-grounded while others appear to be socially constructed. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gender_inequality
